column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to Amy Ronald'''.<ref>{{CG|C}}

column3: and photograph of the letter was included in ''[[Bloomsbury Literature
column4: Manuscripts and Modern First Editions 6 December 2007]]''.

column3: recent health issues (Tolkien's wife's and Amy Ronald's)
column4: and discussing a translation of ''The Hobbit''
column5: "I shall be interested to hear how the French version of Le Hobbit strikes you. Personally I think one of the most unfortunate results of the French invasion of England was the adulteration of our own language. With the consequence that we have a large Franco-Latin ingredient
column7: and specially used when we are being 'adult'
column9: or professional. So that French (to those who do not know it well) sounds often priggish in colloquial dialogue".<ref>[http://www.bloomsburyauctions.com/detail/634/395.0 Bloomsburyauctions.com]
